requirements.text: The UI must use blue and not red.
Integrate with the existing SQL DB.
User flow: Login -> Dashboard-profile -> ERROR (handle error gracefully).
Remove premium features due to budget cut.
Focus on the Minimum Viable Product (MVP).
Application must be responsive and load screens in under 5 seconds.
The application must be compatible with the existing SQL database version.
The application must maintain data integrity when operating offline and synchronizing data.

user_stories.user_story: As a user, I want to be able to use the application offline, so that I can access its features even without an internet connection.
acceptance_criteria: Given I am offline, When I launch the application, Then I should be able to access the features that do not require an internet connection.
Given I am offline and have made changes to data, When I reconnect to the internet, Then the application should synchronize my changes with the server.
Given I am offline, When I try to access a feature that requires an internet connection, Then I should receive a clear message indicating that the feature is unavailable offline.

user_stories.user_story: As a user, I want the UI to use blue as the primary color, so that the application aligns with the brand guidelines and provides a consistent user experience.
acceptance_criteria: Given I am using the application, When I navigate through different screens, Then the primary UI elements (buttons, headers, etc.) should be blue.
Given I am using the application, When an error message is displayed, Then the error message should not be displayed in red.
Given I am using the application, When I view the application's color scheme, Then the primary color should be blue.

user_stories.user_story: As a developer, I want to integrate with the existing SQL database, so that the application can access and manage existing data.
acceptance_criteria: Given the application is running, When it attempts to connect to the SQL database, Then the connection should be established successfully.
Given the application is connected to the SQL database, When it queries data, Then the data should be retrieved accurately.
Given the application is connected to the SQL database, When it updates data, Then the changes should be reflected in the database.

user_stories.user_story: As a user, I want a dark mode option, so that I can reduce eye strain in low-light environments.
acceptance_criteria: Given I am using the application, When I enable dark mode, Then the UI should switch to a dark color scheme.
Given I am using the application in dark mode, When I navigate through different screens, Then the dark color scheme should be applied consistently.
Given I am using the application, When I disable dark mode, Then the UI should revert to the default light color scheme.

user_stories.user_story: As a user, I want the application to handle errors gracefully during the login to dashboard-profile flow, so that I have a smooth and informative user experience.
acceptance_criteria: Given I enter invalid login credentials, When I attempt to log in, Then I should receive a clear and informative error message.
Given I am logged in and navigate to the dashboard-profile, When an unexpected error occurs, Then I should be shown a user-friendly error message without crashing the application.
Given I encounter an error during the login or dashboard-profile flow, When the error occurs, Then the application should log the error for debugging purposes.

user_stories.user_story: As a product owner, I want to remove premium features, so that the application aligns with the reduced budget.
acceptance_criteria: Given the application is running, When a user attempts to access a premium feature, Then the feature should be disabled or removed.
Given the application is running, When the application is deployed, Then the premium features should not be included in the build.
Given the application is running, When the application is updated, Then the premium features should be removed from the application.

user_stories.user_story: As a product owner, I want the development team to focus on the Minimum Viable Product (MVP), so that we can release a functional version of the application quickly.
acceptance_criteria: Given the development team is working on the application, When prioritizing features, Then they should prioritize the core features required for the MVP.
Given the development team is working on the application, When making design decisions, Then they should focus on simplicity and functionality over advanced features.
Given the development team is working on the application, When testing the application, Then they should ensure that the core features of the MVP are working correctly.

user_stories.user_story: As a user, I want the application to be responsive and load screens quickly, so that I have a smooth and efficient user experience.
acceptance_criteria: Given I am using the application, When I navigate to a new screen, Then the screen should load in under 5 seconds.
Given I am using the application on a mobile device, When I interact with the UI, Then the application should respond quickly and smoothly.
Given I am using the application, When I perform a search, Then the results should be displayed quickly.

user_stories.user_story: As a developer, I want the application to be compatible with the existing SQL database version, so that we can avoid costly database upgrades.
acceptance_criteria: Given the application is running, When it connects to the existing SQL database, Then the connection should be established successfully without errors.
Given the application is connected to the existing SQL database, When it performs queries and updates, Then the data should be accessed and modified correctly.
Given the application is running, When the database schema is updated, Then the application should continue to function correctly with the updated schema.

user_stories.user_story: As a user, I want the application to maintain data integrity when operating offline and synchronizing data, so that my data is accurate and consistent.
acceptance_criteria: Given I am offline and modify data, When I reconnect to the internet and synchronize, Then my changes should be saved without data loss or corruption.
Given multiple users are modifying the same data offline, When they reconnect and synchronize, Then the application should handle conflicts gracefully and prevent data loss.
Given I am using the application offline, When the application synchronizes data, Then the application should validate the data to ensure its integrity.

user_stories.user_story: As a project manager, I want the development team to be aware of the deadline, so that they can prioritize tasks and deliver the application on time.
acceptance_criteria: Given the development team is planning the sprint, When they estimate tasks, Then they should consider the deadline and prioritize tasks accordingly.
Given the development team is working on the application, When they encounter roadblocks, Then they should escalate them promptly to ensure the deadline is met.
Given the development team is tracking progress, When they review the progress, Then they should compare it to the deadline and adjust the plan as needed.

risks.text: Data synchronization conflicts when coming back online.
Loss of data if offline storage is corrupted.

assumptions: Offline data storage mechanism is reliable.
Conflicts during sync can be resolved automatically or manually.

risks.text: Accessibility issues if blue is not used correctly (contrast).

assumptions: The specific shade of blue is defined and accessible.
No existing UI elements use red.

risks.text: Database connection failures.
Data corruption during integration.

assumptions: Database credentials are valid and accessible.
Database schema is compatible.

risks.text: Dark mode implementation introduces visual bugs.
Inconsistent dark mode across different screens.

assumptions: Dark mode color palette is defined.
All UI components support dark mode.

risks.text: Poor error handling leads to application crashes.
Sensitive information exposed in error messages.

assumptions: Error logging mechanism is in place.
Error messages are user-friendly and informative.

risks.text: Removal of premium features impacts user satisfaction.
Code refactoring introduces bugs.

assumptions: Users are informed about the removal of premium features.
Alternative features are provided to compensate for the removal.

risks.text: Scope creep delays MVP release.
Essential features are cut due to time constraints.

assumptions: MVP scope is clearly defined and agreed upon.
Stakeholders understand the limitations of the MVP.

risks.text: Performance issues on low-end devices.
Network latency impacts loading times.

assumptions: Application is optimized for performance.
Network infrastructure is reliable.

risks.text: Incompatibility issues with the existing database version.
Data loss or corruption due to compatibility issues.

assumptions: Database version is known and documented.
Application is tested against the existing database version.

risks.text: Data corruption during offline operation.
Synchronization conflicts lead to data loss.

assumptions: Data validation is performed before synchronization.
Conflict resolution mechanism is in place.

risks.text: Inability to meet the deadline due to unforeseen issues.
Compromised quality due to rushed development.

assumptions: Team is able to work efficiently.
No major roadblocks will be encountered.

scenario_results.summary: Adding 20% to the scope will significantly impact the timeline, given the extremely tight deadline of 4 weeks (REQ-011) and the very small team size of 3. The complexity will increase due to the additional requirements, potentially introducing new dependencies and risks related to data integrity (REQ-010) and database compatibility (REQ-009). The risk of not meeting the deadline (REQ-011) and scope creep (REQ-007) will be amplified. The small team size will struggle to deliver the increased scope within the limited timeframe. UI/UX risks and performance impacts will also be exacerbated. Given the feedback from the previous simulation, the timeline impact is increased to reflect the team size and deadline.

Losing a developer from the team will severely impact the timeline, especially with the existing deadline pressure (REQ-011) and the already infeasible baseline timeline given the small team size of 3. The remaining developers will need to cover the lost capacity, increasing the risk of errors and reduced code quality. This will also impact the ability to address risks related to database integration (REQ-003) and offline data synchronization (REQ-001). The team's ability to focus on the MVP (REQ-007) will be compromised. The impact on addressing UI/UX risks and performance issues will also be significant. Given the feedback from the previous simulation, the timeline impact is increased to reflect the team size and deadline; losing 1 of 3 developers is near-catastrophic.

If a critical dependency fails (e.g., the SQL database or the synchronization service), the project will be severely impacted. This could halt development entirely, making it impossible to meet the deadline (REQ-011). The risks associated with data integrity (REQ-010), database compatibility (REQ-009), and offline functionality (REQ-001) will be significantly amplified. Addressing the dependency failure will likely require significant rework and could introduce new risks and complexities. The small team size will struggle to recover from such a failure. This scenario also exacerbates the risks related to UI/UX and performance. The timeline impact is extremely high, as a critical dependency failure will likely require a complete project restart.

If the application is incompatible with the existing SQL database version (REQ-009), the project will face significant delays and potential rework. This scenario directly addresses the high-priority risk identified in the RAID log. The team will need to either upgrade the database (if possible), find a workaround, or rewrite significant portions of the application. Data loss or corruption is a major concern. The small team size will struggle to address this issue quickly, making it nearly impossible to meet the deadline (REQ-011).

If data corruption occurs during offline operation (REQ-010), the project will be severely impacted. This scenario directly addresses the high-priority risk identified in the RAID log. Recovering from data corruption will require significant effort, potentially involving data recovery tools and manual intervention. The synchronization process will need to be thoroughly reviewed and potentially redesigned. The small team size will struggle to address this issue quickly, making it difficult to meet the deadline (REQ-011). This also increases the risk of data loss and user dissatisfaction.

If the UI/UX design introduces accessibility issues (REQ-002), such as poor color contrast or difficult-to-use elements, the project will require rework. This scenario addresses the risk of accessibility issues identified in the RAID log. Addressing these issues will involve redesigning UI elements and conducting accessibility testing. While not as critical as database or data corruption issues, this scenario will still impact the timeline and require effort from the UI/UX team. The small team size will need to prioritize accessibility fixes alongside other tasks.
